EmailTemplate.subject: UPDATED INFORMATION ON THE COON RAPIDS TRANSITION- DAA, ADC, ADM & FUEL PROBES TRANSITION TO DEER VALLEY
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Customer,
As Honeywell advised in 2019, we have decided to optimize our operations and close our Coon Rapids, Minnesota facility by Q1 2021. The transition teams are engaged and details for all move phases are being incorporated into the overall project plan. As a reminder, the product lines affected by this transition include:
- Commercial Inertial Reference Units (IRUs), Data Acquisition Units (DAU), Yaw Damper and Flame Sensors are moving to the Honeywell Clearwater, Florida site. - (UPDATE) Digital Analog Adaptor (DAA), Air Data Computer (ADC), Air Data Management and Fuel Probe repairs are moving to the Honeywell Deer Valley, Arizona site. - Control Sensor Products (CSP). This will move from our Golden Valley site to the Honeywell Clearwater, Florida site.

Please note: This transition requires moving equipment from Coon Rapids to the Deer Valley location. This will result in a short delay period as the equipment is being transferred and setup at the Deer Valley site. The estimated completion of the equipment move is July 31st. No work will be done on the impacted components during this transition period. Please adjust your supply plan as needed.
Information for Authorized Supplier List and Internal Systems Please update your authorized supplier list (ASL) and internal systems as needed to reference the new supplier information for these parts.

To minimize delays with your orders, please follow these guidelines and actions:
What to do now?
- Prepare for upcoming transition: Review the transition schedule and impacted parts list <[[https://pages3.honeywell.com/rs/641-QIX-912/images/Honeywell_Coon-Rapids_Impacted-Parts_7.2020.xlsx]]>, adjust your supply plan as needed, resolve outstanding holds to minimize transition delays, and take actions to ensure internal systems are updated to reflect the correct Honeywell location on the correlating transition dates
- Set/schedule updates to your internal ERP/MRP systems to support correct shipping destination per Tables 1 & 2 shown above (dates/site).
- Update Authorized Supplier List (ASL) as needed: If Deer Valley is not already on your ASL, start working to add the new supplier to your approved supplier list. If you need to conduct an on-site audit, please email your Honeywell Representative.
Repair Order Processing (Part 145)
- Honeywell will work to fulfill repair orders already on site at Coon Rapids. - Some repair orders may require a place of performance purchase order or contract modification. - If a modification is required, your Honeywell Customer Business Manager, Honeywell Contracts Manager or Honeywell Support Representative will contact you to advise and coordinate the activity.
- Watch for PO or contract modification request from AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com <[[mailto:AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com]]>.
New Repair Orders
- To minimize delays to your repair, ensure that new repair orders are sent to the new location. - Part numbers received on or before July 13, 2020 will be accepted at Coon Rapids. - Honeywell will send part numbers that are in transit and received within 7 days of the ‘Coon Rapids Last Receipt Date’ to Deer Valley for repair.
- A PO/contract modification may be required. - The Honeywell Customer Business Manager, Honeywell Contracts Manager or Honeywell Support Representative will be in contact to advise and coordinate that activity.
- The MyAerospace Repair Site Capability list <[[https://aerospace2.honeywell.com/onlineordering/repair-capabilities/]]> (ROCAPS) will be updated to allow for real-time queries about where to send your repairs
Original Equipment and Spares (Part 21)
- At this time, there is no change to how original equipment (OE) and aftermarket spares orders are ordered.
AOG Support
- There is no change on how Honeywell will support AOG shipments for this hardware.
Our goal is to always provide you with the quality and service that you deserve. We will send out additional communications as we move closer to the next transition phase. If you have any questions about this transition, please reach out to your Honeywell point of contact.
Sincerely,
Honeywell Aerospace Customer & Product Support
